trans-unit.source: You need an Azure account to complete the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You need an Azure account to complete the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: You get credits that can be used to try out paid Azure services.
trans-unit.target: You get credits that can be used to try out paid Azure services.

trans-unit.source: Even after the credits are used up, you can keep the account and use free Azure services and features, such as the Web Apps feature in Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: Even after the credits are used up, you can keep the account and use free Azure services and features, such as the Web Apps feature in Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: Your MSDN subscription gives you credits every month that you can use for paid Azure services.
trans-unit.target: Your MSDN subscription gives you credits every month that you can use for paid Azure services.

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before you sign up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751).
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before you sign up for an Azure account, go to [Try App Service](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=523751).

trans-unit.source: There, you can immediately create a short-lived starter app in App Service — no credit card required, and no commitments.
trans-unit.target: There, you can immediately create a short-lived starter app in App Service — no credit card required, and no commitments.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 with the Azure SDK for .NET
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 with the Azure SDK for .NET

trans-unit.source: The tutorial is written for Visual Studio 2015 with the Azure SDK for .NET 2.8.2 or later.
trans-unit.target: The tutorial is written for Visual Studio 2015 with the Azure SDK for .NET 2.8.2 or later.

trans-unit.source: If you have an earlier version, or if you don't have Visual Studio 2015, [download the latest Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2015](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=518003).
trans-unit.target: If you have an earlier version, or if you don't have Visual Studio 2015, [download the latest Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2015](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=518003).

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 is automatically installed with the SDK if you don't already have it.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 is automatically installed with the SDK if you don't already have it.

trans-unit.source: If you have Visual Studio 2013, and you want to use that, [download the latest Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=324322).
trans-unit.target: If you have Visual Studio 2013, and you want to use that, [download the latest Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=324322).

trans-unit.source: The instructions are basically the same but some screens may look different.
trans-unit.target: The instructions are basically the same but some screens may look different.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Depending on how many of the SDK dependencies you already have on your machine, installing the SDK could take a long time, from several minutes to a half hour or more.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Depending on how many of the SDK dependencies you already have on your machine, installing the SDK could take a long time, from several minutes to a half hour or more.

trans-unit.source: The tutorial assumes that you have a basic knowledge of how to work with ASP.NET [Web API 2](http://www.asp.net/web-api/overview/getting-started-with-aspnet-web-api/tutorial-your-first-web-api) in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: The tutorial assumes that you have a basic knowledge of how to work with ASP.NET [Web API 2](http://www.asp.net/web-api/overview/getting-started-with-aspnet-web-api/tutorial-your-first-web-api) in Visual Studio.
